Node.definition: = exclamation encouraging people to act
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= the results of laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= state in which someone's desire for food has been fulfilled
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at
= state in which the body of humans or animals contains a significant quantity of fat, ≈ which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well being

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= state in which an event is likely to last for a long time, ≈ which can be either good or bad
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to honor|to make glorious|to make great
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities cause humans or objects to have honor, majesty and splendor
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans on a spiritual journey find God
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which an object is located high up in the air and out of human reach; ≈ sometimes used as a metaphor to describe things that are beyond human understanding
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which an object is located high up in the air and out of human reach; ≈ sometimes used as a metaphor to describe things that are beyond human understanding
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= water that has fallen as rain

= frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which objects move back into the direction they came from
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to cause to give birth; hence: = causative process by which things are brough into existence

Node.gloss: to cause to sprout|to make come up|to cause to bring forth
Node.definition: = causative process by which a deity or the earth causes plants or horns to come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities
= a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: (word) come out of (someone); hence: = process by which words are spoken by humans or deities
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: to return (without having reached its goal); = process by which an event fails to reach its intended goal
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= action by which humans complete a task with the expected or desired outcome
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
= state in which humans feel and show great joy

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
= action by which humans strike the palms of their hands together repeatedly ► as an expression of joy

Node.gloss: to clap (one's) hands (for joy or glee)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = to strike the palms of one's hands together ≈ as a symbol of joy and appreciation
= some kind of thorny plant; ► associated with neglect and regarded as painful nuisance
= process by which a plant,or part of a plant, comes up from the ground or grows from a stalk

exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon
= plant with stinging hairs; ◄ Urtica family; ► associated with neglect and regarded as painful nuisance
= process by which a plant,or part of a plant, comes up from the ground or grows from a stalk

= an evergreen tree or bush, up to 1.5 m. high; dark glossy leaves are dense on the branches, and the flowers are white or pink; the whole plant gives off an agreeable odor; ► used by the Jews in the Feast of Tabernacles; regarded as a desirable tree, as opposed to thorns and thistles
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: to cut off (an event); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to stop happening
